name: Lansoprazole

ingredients.name: METHACRYLIC ACID AND ETHYL ACRYLATE COPOLYMER

indications: lansoprazole delayed-release capsule proton pump inhibitor ( ppis ) indicated : • treatment active duodenal ulcer adults . ( 1.1 ) • eradication h. pylori reduce risk duodenal ulcer recurrence adults . ( 1.2 ) • maintenance healed duodenal ulcers adults . ( 1.3 ) • treatment active benign gastric ulcer adults . ( 1.4 ) • healing nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs ( nsaid ) -associated gastric ulcer adults . ( 1.5 ) • risk reduction nsaid-associated gastric ulcer adults . ( 1.6 ) • treatment symptomatic gastroesophageal reflux disease ( gerd ) adults pediatric patients 1 year age older . ( 1.7 ) • treatment erosive esophagitis ( ee ) adults pediatric patients 1 year age older . ( 1.8 ) • maintenance healing ee adults . ( 1.9 ) • pathological hypersecretory conditions , including zollinger-ellison syndrome ( zes ) adults . ( 1.10 )
contraindications: recommended : • full prescribing information complete dosing information lansoprazole delayed-release capsule indication age group adjustment patients severe hepatic impairment . ( 2.1 , 2.2 , 2.3 ) instructions ( 2.4 ) lansoprazole delayed-release capsules • swallowed whole . • full prescribing information alternative options .
warningsAndPrecautions: lansoprazole delayed release capsules usp , 30 mg white pale yellow colored enteric coated pellets filled size ‘ 1 ’ hard gelatin capsules opaque pink colored cap opaque black colored body , imprinted ‘ rdy ’ cap ‘ 399 ’ body white ink . supplied cartons 80 delayed release capsules ( 10 delayed release capsules blister pack x 8 ) , ndc 0904-6662-45
adverseReactions: • lansoprazole delayed-release capsules contraindicated patients known severe hypersensitivity component formulation . hypersensitivity may include anaphylaxis , anaphylactic shock , angioedema , bronchospasm , acute tubulointerstitial nephritis , urticaria [ ( 5.2 ) , ( 6 ) ] . • proton pump inhibitors ( ppis ) , including lansoprazole delayed-release capsules contraindicated rilpivirine-containing products [ ( 7 ) ] . • information antibacterial agents ( clarithromycin amoxicillin ) indicated combination lansoprazole delayed-release capsules , refer section prescribing information .
indications_original: Lansoprazole delayed-release capsule is a proton pump inhibitor (PPIs) indicated for the: • Treatment of active duodenal ulcer in adults. ( 1.1 ) • Eradication of H. pylori to reduce the risk of duodenal ulcer recurrence in adults. ( 1.2 ) • Maintenance of healed duodenal ulcers in adults. ( 1.3 ) • Treatment of active benign gastric ulcer in adults. ( 1.4 ) • Healing of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID)-associated gastric ulcer in adults. ( 1.5 ) • Risk reduction of NSAID-associated gastric ulcer in adults. ( 1.6 ) • Treatment of symptomatic gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) in adults and pediatric patients 1 year of age and older.( 1.7 ) • Treatment of erosive esophagitis (EE) in adults and pediatric patients 1 year of age and older. ( 1.8 ) • Maintenance of healing of EE in adults. ( 1.9 ) • Pathological hypersecretory conditions, including Zollinger-Ellison syndrome (ZES) in adults. ( 1.10 )
contraindications_original: Recommended Dosage: • See full prescribing information for complete dosing information for lansoprazole delayed-release capsule by indication and age group and dosage adjustment in patients with severe hepatic impairment. ( 2.1 , 2.2 , 2.3 ) Administration Instructions ( 2.4 ) Lansoprazole delayed-release capsules • Should be swallowed whole. • See full prescribing information for alternative administration options.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Lansoprazole delayed release capsules USP, 30 mg are white to pale yellow colored enteric coated pellets filled in size ‘1’ hard gelatin capsules with opaque pink colored cap and opaque black colored body, imprinted ‘RDY’ on cap and ‘399’ on body with white ink. They are supplied
                  Cartons of 80 delayed release capsules (10 delayed release capsules each blister pack x 8), NDC 0904-6662-45
